text.p: These were the headlines on Estonian Kuku radio at noon. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
-Washington-based Carnegie Foundation has invited former PM Mart Laar to become a member of its economic reform chamber.

-The most watched television programme in Estonia in February is "Dating Game" with one third of the population watching the show, and the average person watched four hours and 18 minutes of television a week.
- Parliament gave the corruption investigation committee increased investigative powers.
